attributes.action: Introduce efficencies in the Public Sector (health, government etc)
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
There have been many headlines recently about what the NHS spends our taxes on and what it cannot afford to spend our taxes on.

It cannot afford Alzheimer's drugs apparently.

A recent newspaper report alleged that the very same NHS spent £300 Million pounds on tattoo removal.

Is this really what the NHS is for ?

Shouldn't we be saying "no" ?

Shouldn't we be making all public bodies more efficient rather than increase the tax take to pay for more and more things.

The tattoo example, if real, is a fundamental abuse of what the NHS is supposed to be for - fixing medical needs, not just removing "johnny loves jane" so "johnny" can subsequently replace the tattoo with someting which will no longer cause mental anguish. 

Quite probably a new tattoo declaring "johnny loves sarah".
